title: Proof things are getting better
body:
See those? 

Yeah, thats right. 

Progress bois.

replies.body: Ayy my friend, things are getting better PR wise. The vast majority are fan skins, jokes, funny threads, and some "how to deal with (insert token problem here)". What I want to see is the corresponding Riot employees being more active in threads regarding balance, bugs, lore, champion reworks/updates(no matter their scale), matchmaking and server issues, exploits, intentional feeders. And let us not forget those red posts right there are mostly from the same Rioters time and again(blessed you based Riot KateyKhaos).
I'd want the same but 9/10 when I check those balance threads they're usually just people bitching about how they lost against a certain champion and then claiming how they're too op and need a nerf.

> [{quoted}](name=Avian Dreams,realm=NA,application-id=bzRrPGQO,discussion-id=jWIukuEo,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-04-05T00:08:31.333+0000)
>
> I'd want the same but 9/10 when I check those balance threads they're usually just people bitching about how they lost against a certain champion and then claiming how they're too op and need a nerf.

Boards, like every other thread, has it's own set of hypocrits and a rather satisfying amount of circlejerking. No exceptions. Wether those champions are indeed in need of nerfs/tweeks or not is a subject to disguss but not worthy enough to take up my time when I could be getting updated on Fiora and Yorick's reworks(they both got benched because bigger projects are of importance), the misserable state of the lore and more. 
I don't need Meddler telling me the state of Nidalee is extremely powerfull but because the meta swifted to tank junglers she might fall off again, no, fucking nerf her and everything's gonna be allright. Time wasted where you could've spent making a proper fucking rework for Kassadin, a Zac skin, Zed tweaks etc etc.
I want to be involved when my favorite champions get a skin, instead of waiting for it to be served on a plate, I want to be involved when my favorite champion gets their lore changed, not stand back when they get a misserable 2-liner and then cry in a corner. Instead I'm having the game dictated by some retards obsessed with the meta-game and their nerd-culture that is LCS -_did TSM wonnered?_-. 
I'm just going to stand back and watch as yet another thing I love gets ruined for the sake of the playerbase, that playerbase than all it does is cry in the boards. Because what makes my opinion more important/special than whomever idiot's got topvoted for their "nidalee OP plz nerf" thread for the 110th time? 
Not to mention that every time they fuck things up they completely ignore the Boards, then come after a while being all like "it was our fault we didn't communicate enough" and "we believe _X_ thing is in an _X_ state right now be we could've conveyed our plans better" At this state of the game I wouldn't be surprise they come up with a Tribunal hold-up and then start apologizing they could've kept us updated better but they didn't, and then move on with their lives LIKE EVERY SINGLE TIME SO FAR. 

PJsalt
I agree riot never talks about the bugs/OP champ opinions/Afk,Feeder in rank. All I see them comment on are picture or just something not worth even looking at.

Only like, 2 of those posts were actually in need of a red post. the others were just fun posts that reds tend to post in to look active when we know they aren't. Its not about how much the post more of WHAT they post in.

riot posted like 0 times in the 5.4 patch

wonder why
We dont talk about that patch anymore

> [{quoted}](name=Cameron2325,realm=NA,application-id=bzRrPGQO,discussion-id=jWIukuEo,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-04-04T20:12:17.624+0000)
>
> We dont talk about that patch anymore

what patch?

To be fair, nothings really happpening atm.

If it doesn't pick up once a new pbe update hits, or patch notes, feel free to crucify me

It's not really about the content cycle, from a communication perspective; there are still tons of legitimate complaints and discussions people would like to have with Riot even in the middle of a patch.  Communication is not just something that needs to happen when everything's hitting the fan, it needs consistency and persistence to become truly relevant.
Meanwhile, in the "Report a Bug" forum...

> [{quoted}](name=Urdnot Entar,realm=NA,application-id=bzRrPGQO,discussion-id=jWIukuEo,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-04-08T04:26:00.582+0000)
>
> Meanwhile, in the "Report a Bug" forum...

To be fair, that's understandable. They probably do read that forum but by the time a bug is reproduced and assigned, the thread is long gone and probably not saved with the bug to begin with.

I would accept that if they were doing much of anything about bugs, but they're just not. There have been intermittent, game-breaking bugs hanging around the game for literally years, and it's like they have one guy fixing a bug here and there so they can say they're doing more than zero.
Look at #3 with the shit ton of upvotes....that's me!!
